intro: Jussiaea, commonly known as the water starwort, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Onagraceae. These plants are typically aquatic or semi-aquatic, often found in wetlands, ponds, and slow-moving streams. They are characterized by their small, star-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink. Jussiaea species have opposite, usually narrow leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. They play an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small fish.
